title: Fix admin login credentials not working

requirements.text: Fix the login authentication logic in useAuth.ts so that logging in with username 'admin' and password 'admin123' works correctly. Ensure the seeded default admin account is always initialized in localStorage before the login check runs, so the credentials are found and validated successfully.

quotes: masih belum bisa log in setelah saya masukan user name sdmin dan pasword admin123 klik masuk tapi tidak bisa

acceptanceCriteria: Entering username 'admin' and password 'admin123' on the login page and clicking the login button successfully authenticates the user.
After successful login, the user is redirected to the main dashboard/home page.
No 'something went wrong' error or blank page is shown during or after login.
If credentials are wrong, a clear error message is displayed without crashing the page.

requirements.text: Ensure the LoginPage renders correctly at all times â€” it must never show a blank page or an unhandled error screen. Wrap the login form in an error boundary or add defensive checks so that any runtime error displays a user-friendly fallback message instead of a blank/crashed page.

quotes: halaman login nya tidak ada hanya tulisa something went wrong

acceptanceCriteria: The login page always renders the login form with username and password fields.
No blank page or unhandled 'something went wrong' error is shown when navigating to the login route.
Any unexpected runtime error on the login page shows a user-friendly error message instead of a blank screen.

constraints: Do not change the backend schema or Motoko actor.
Authentication must continue to use localStorage via the useAuth hook.
Do not modify files listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
nonGoals: Adding new user roles or permissions.
